This article is about the municipality in Uttar Pradesh, India. For its namesake district, see Deoria district.

Deoria is a city in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is one of five tehsils of the Deoria district. Deoria is located 50 km to the southeast of Gorakhpur and about 310 km from the state capital Lucknow.

Demography[edit]

See also: List of cities in Uttar Pradesh
Religions in Deoria
Religion Percent
Hindus
 
 88%
Muslims
 
 11%
Others†
 
 1%
Distribution of religions
†Includes Jains (0.5%), Buddhists (<0.2%).

As per provisional data of the 2011 census, Deoria had a population of 129,570, out of which there were 67,754 males and 61,816 females. The literacy rate was 93.73 per cent.[1]

According to the 2001 census Deoria had 104,222 inhabitants (54,737 men, 49,485 women).[2]

References[edit]

  1. ^ "Urban Agglomerations/Cities having population 1 lakh and above" (PDF). Provisional Population Totals, Census of India 2011. Retrieved 2012-07-07. 
  2. ^ Census of India 2001. "Population, population in the age group 0-6 and literates by sex - Cities/Towns (in alphabetic order): 2001". Archived from the original on 16 June 2004. Retrieved 20 June 2008.
